greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Product_{h == 1 (mod 4) and h|n} h.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: a:= n-> mul(i, i=select(h-> irem(h, 4)=1, divisors(n))):
mathematica: a[n_] := Times @@ Select[Divisors[n], Mod[#, 4] == 1&]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 120}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 24 2015 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(p=1); fordiv(n, d, if ((d % 4)==1, p*=d)); p; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 07 2021
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 27 2008
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 28 2009
